snippet: A primer on Nevada politics, from the tumultuous 2010 elections to the quirky caucus rules, the Mormon vote and Yucca Mountain, from The Las Vegas Review-Journal's politics reporter.
abstract: A primer on Nevada politics, from the tumultuous 2010 elections to the quirky caucus rules, the Mormon vote and Yucca Mountain, from The Las Vegas Review-Journal's politics reporter.
lead_paragraph: We tapped Laura Myers (@lmyerslvrj) of The Las Vegas Review-Journal to give us a local's perspective on the state of the race in the Silver State. A native Nevadan, Ms. Myers has been covering politics for The Review-Journal for the past two years, following a long tenure at The Associated Press that included a stint as political editor during the Bush-Gore race in 2000. Her list of must-reads is below (and also available to go, on our Election 2012 mobile app, which has more of the best, hand-picked politics coverage from around the Web).

headline.main: Nevada Tip Sheet: A Vegas Reporter's Must-Reads
